description.narrative: The overall purpose of the program is to work towards establishment of a safe environment for HRDs to conduct their work. The beneficiaries of the project are primarily HRDs involved in monitoring the implementation of and the realization of rights enshrin ed in the new constitution and enhancing citizen participation in the devolved system of government. Further they are also involved in monitoring documenting and reporting on human rights violations particularly during the upcoming National and County Elec tions advocating for access to justice for victims of election related violence holding perpetrators of violence to account including through the ICC process upholding the rule of law while combating terrorism and the realization of rights of historically marginalized groups. objectives: a) Strengthen the capacity of National Secretariat to advance its mandate,b) To rapidly respond to safety and protection needs of human rights defenders in Kenya in the coming two years through relocation legal medical and psycho-social support, c) Ongoing monitoring of human rights defenders issues in order to develop proactive protection measures like trainings advocacy for enactment of laws and policies for safety at work,d) build their capacity through training and facil itation to make them strong advocates for change at the local level by engaging with local actors and holding the duty bearer accountable,e) promote public awareness and grassroots support for human rights defenders work, andf) Build strong lobbying and ad vocacy networks with partners at the local regional and international level to lobby and advocate for the development of a legal and policy environment that support HRD work.
